Title: How to use the function "getStreamUserToken" from Firebase Authenticate with Stream Chat extension in client-side Angular?
Body:
<p>I am trying to use the getStreamUserToken function from Firebase Authenticate with Stream Chat extension in an Angular client-side application. However, my implementation is not working as expected. Here's the code I have tried:</p>
<p>The function:</p>
<pre><code>// Get Stream user token.
export const getStreamUserToken = functions.https.onCall((data, context) =&gt; {
  // Checking that the user is authenticated.
  if (!context.auth) {
    // Throwing an HttpsError so that the client gets the error details.
    throw new functions.https.HttpsError(
      &quot;failed-precondition&quot;,
      &quot;The function must be called while authenticated.&quot;,
    );
  } else {
    try {
      return serverClient.createToken(
        context.auth.uid,
        undefined,
        Math.floor(new Date().getTime() / 1000),
      );
    } catch (err) {
      console.error(`Unable to get user token with ID ${context.auth.uid} on Stream. Error ${err}`);
      // Throwing an HttpsError so that the client gets the error details.
      throw new functions.https.HttpsError(&quot;aborted&quot;, &quot;Could not get Stream user&quot;);
    }
  }
});
</code></pre>
<p>My client-side code attempt:</p>
<pre><code>getStreamToken() {
const result = httpsCallable(
  this.functions,
  'getStreamUserToken'
);
result({}).then((response) =&gt; {
  console.log(response.data);
});
</code></pre>
<p>The getStreamUserToken function is a Firebase Callable Cloud Function that requires the user to be authenticated. It uses the serverClient.createToken method to generate a Stream user token based on the authenticated user's UID.</p>
<p>I expect the getStreamUserToken function to return a Stream user token, but it throws an error instead.</p>
<pre><code>Access to fetch at 'https://...' from origin 'http://localhost:4200' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.
zone.js:1498     

POST https://... net::ERR_FAILED
</code></pre>
<p>Can someone please guide me on how to properly use the getStreamUserToken function in an Angular client-side application? Any help would be greatly appreciated.</p>

Title: Android Widget text update
Body:
<p>I have trouble updating my widget text, with the current location each 1000 ms, i only get the default text in the widget, not the location, can anyone give a hint.</p>
<p>The permissions in the manifest is correct, and works in the main application where the location is updated and displayed in the layout.</p>
<pre><code>import android.appwidget.AppWidgetManager;
import android.appwidget.AppWidgetProvider;
import android.content.Context;
import android.content.pm.PackageManager;
import android.widget.RemoteViews;
import android.location.Location;

import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
import androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat;

import com.google.android.gms.location.FusedLocationProviderClient;
import com.google.android.gms.location.LocationCallback;
import com.google.android.gms.location.LocationRequest;
import com.google.android.gms.location.LocationResult;
import com.google.android.gms.location.LocationServices;

import dk.seahawk.hamlocator.algorithm.GridAlgorithm;
import dk.seahawk.hamlocator.algorithm.GridAlgorithmInterface;


public class HamLocatorWidget extends AppWidgetProvider {
    private Context context;

    private static final int LOCATION_PERMISSION_REQUEST_CODE = 100;
    private FusedLocationProviderClient fusedLocationClient;
    private LocationCallback locationCallback;
    private int INTERVAL = 1000;   // location refresh rate
    private GridAlgorithmInterface gridAlgorithmInterface;


    @Override
    public void onUpdate(Context context, AppWidgetManager appWidgetManager, int[] appWidgetIds) {
        this.context = context;

        for (int appWidgetId : appWidgetIds) {
            RemoteViews views = new RemoteViews(context.getPackageName(), R.layout.ham_locator_widget);

            // Initialize FusedLocationProviderClient
            fusedLocationClient = LocationServices.getFusedLocationProviderClient(context);

            // Initialize Maidenhead algorithm
            gridAlgorithmInterface = new GridAlgorithm();

            // Create and configure LocationCallback
            locationCallback = new LocationCallback() {
                @Override
                public void onLocationResult(@NonNull LocationResult locationResult) {
                    Location location = locationResult.getLastLocation();
                    assert location != null;

                    // Update location parameters
                    String lastLocation = gridAlgorithmInterface.getGridLocation(location);

                    views.setTextViewText(R.id.appwidget_text, lastLocation);
                    appWidgetManager.updateAppWidget(appWidgetId, views);

                    // Stop location updates after obtaining the location
                    stopLocationUpdates();
                }
            };

            // Start requesting location updates
            startLocationUpdates();
        }
    }

    @Override
    public void onEnabled(Context context) {
        startLocationUpdates();
    }

    @Override
    public void onDisabled(Context context) {
        stopLocationUpdates();
    }

    private void startLocationUpdates() {
        LocationRequest locationRequest = LocationRequest.create();
        locationRequest.setPriority(LOCATION_PERMISSION_REQUEST_CODE);
        locationRequest.setInterval(INTERVAL); // Update interval in milliseconds

        if (ActivityCompat.checkSelfPermission(context, android.Manifest.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION) != PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &amp;&amp; ActivityCompat.checkSelfPermission(context, android.Manifest.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION) != PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) {
            return;
        }
        fusedLocationClient.requestLocationUpdates(locationRequest, locationCallback, null);
    }

    private void stopLocationUpdates() {
        if (fusedLocationClient != null &amp;&amp; locationCallback != null) {
            fusedLocationClient.removeLocationUpdates(locationCallback);
        }
    }

}
</code></pre>
<p>Here is the xml info file</p>
<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;utf-8&quot;?&gt;
&lt;appwidget-provider xmlns:android=&quot;http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android&quot;
    android:description=&quot;@string/app_widget_description&quot;
    android:initialKeyguardLayout=&quot;@layout/ham_locator_widget&quot;
    android:initialLayout=&quot;@layout/ham_locator_widget&quot;
    android:minWidth=&quot;110dp&quot;
    android:minHeight=&quot;40dp&quot;

    android:previewLayout=&quot;@layout/ham_locator_widget&quot;
    android:targetCellWidth=&quot;4&quot;
    android:targetCellHeight=&quot;2&quot;
    android:updatePeriodMillis=&quot;1000&quot;
    android:widgetCategory=&quot;home_screen&quot; /&gt;

</code></pre>

Title: Wix Triggered Emails - Send to custom form submitter (not contact OR member)
Body:
<p>Firstly, my site does not have contacts or members or a sign up. It is simply used to register for an activity which then prompts the admin to create them an account in a 3rd party site that they do actually have login information for (this 3rd party site is embedded in my wix site)</p>
<p>I have a custom form in my wix site that is tied to a custom collection. Using automation, I as the admin am receiving an email about the information of the form submission (name, email, etc). The problem however, is that I cant find a way to send my triggered email to the email address of the site visitor that submitted the form.</p>
<p>The reasons for this that I cant seem to workaround are:</p>
<ul>
<li>custom forms dont allow you to send emails in automation, only receive</li>
<li>the send triggered email code I've been able to find online so far only provides examples for sending a triggered email to a currently logged in member or a person thats in your contacts
<ul>
<li>this is done through a unique ID in the contacts table or members table from what I can tell,
neither of which I have</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>I simply need to be able to send a triggered email to the email address of the site viewer who submitted a particular form</p>
<p>Is this possible, thanks!</p>
<p>I tried to play around with this snippet, setting variable names... but again this only works with adding the submitter to your contacts</p>
<pre><code>import { triggeredEmails } from 'wix-crm';
import wixCRM from 'wix-crm';
import { session } from 'wix-storage';

$w.onReady(() =&gt; {
    $w(&quot;#dataset1&quot;).onReady(() =&gt; {
        $w(&quot;#dataset1&quot;).onAfterSave(() =&gt; {

            //TRIGGERED EMAIL  
            wixCRM.createContact({
                &quot;firstName&quot;: $w('#firstName').value,
                &quot;lastName&quot;: $w(&quot;#lastName&quot;).value,
                &quot;emails&quot;: [$w(&quot;#email&quot;).value]

            }).then((contactId) =&gt; {

                triggeredEmails.emailContact(emailId, contactId, {
                    variables: {
                        firstName: session.getItem(&quot;firstName&quot;),
                        lastName: session.getItem(&quot;lastName&quot;),
                        email: session.getItem(&quot;email&quot;)

                    }
                });
            });
            //
        });
    });

    $w(&quot;#firstName, #lastName, #email&quot;).onInput(() =&gt; {

        session.setItem(&quot;firstName&quot;, $w(&quot;#firstName&quot;).value)
        session.setItem(&quot;lastName&quot;, $w(&quot;#lastName&quot;).value)
        session.setItem(&quot;email&quot;, $w(&quot;#email&quot;).value)

    })
});
</code></pre>

Body:

here is the js code</p>
<pre><code>////////////////////////////////////////   ADD TO CART    ///////////////////////////

document.addEventListener(&quot;DOMContentLoaded&quot;, function () {

  let itemCount = parseInt(localStorage.getItem(&quot;cartCount&quot;)) || 0;

    const addButton = event.target; // The clicked &quot;Add to Cart&quot; button

    updateLocalStorage(); // Update local storage with the new action

  function toggleCheckIcon(event) {
    const checkIcon = event.target;
    const productBox = checkIcon.closest(&quot;.product_box&quot;);
    const addButton = productBox.querySelector(&quot;.bx-cart-add&quot;);
    const productId = productBox.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);

      checkIcon.style.display = &quot;none&quot;;
      addButton.style.display = &quot;flex&quot;;
      itemActions[productId] = false; // Mark the item as not added to cart
      itemCount--; // Decrement the cart item count
    } else {
      // &quot;Check&quot; icon is not displayed, toggle it on
      checkIcon.style.display = &quot;flex&quot;;
      addButton.style.display = &quot;none&quot;;
      itemActions[productId] = true; // Mark the item as added to cart
      itemCount++; // Increment the cart item count
    }

    updateCartCount(); // Update the cart count display
    updateLocalStorage(); // Update local storage with the new action
  }

  function updateCartCount() {
    cartCount.textContent = itemCount;
    localStorage.setItem(&quot;cartCount&quot;, itemCount);
  }

  function updateLocalStorage() {
    localStorage.setItem(&quot;itemActions&quot;, JSON.stringify(itemActions));
  }

  function resetItemStates() {
    addToCartButtons.forEach((button) =&gt; {
      const productBox = button.closest(&quot;.product_box&quot;);
      if (productBox) {
        const productId = productBox.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);

        button.style.display = &quot;flex&quot;; // Display the &quot;Add to Cart&quot; button

        const checkIcon = productBox.querySelector(&quot;.bx-check&quot;);
        if (checkIcon) {
          checkIcon.style.display = &quot;none&quot;; // Hide the &quot;Check&quot; icon
        }

        itemActions[productId] = false; // Mark the item as not added to cart
      }
    });

    itemCount = 0; // Reset the cart item count
    updateCartCount(); // Update the cart count display
    updateLocalStorage(); // Update local storage with the new action
  }

  function removeStoredCounts() {
    localStorage.removeItem(&quot;cartCount&quot;);
    localStorage.removeItem(&quot;itemActions&quot;);
    resetItemStates();
  }

  removeCountsButton.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, resetItemStates);

  addToCartButtons.forEach((button) =&gt; {
    const productBox = button.closest(&quot;.product_box&quot;);
    const productId = productBox.getAttribute(&quot;id&quot;);

    if (itemActions[productId]) {
      button.style.display = &quot;none&quot;; // Hide the &quot;Add to Cart&quot; button
      productBox.querySelector(&quot;.bx-check&quot;).style.display = &quot;flex&quot;; // Show the &quot;Check&quot; icon
    }

    button.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, addToCart);
  });

  // Add event listener for clicks on the &quot;bx-check&quot; icon
  document.querySelectorAll(&quot;.bx-check&quot;).forEach((checkIcon) =&gt; {
    checkIcon.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, toggleCheckIcon);
  });
  // Function to update local storage
  function updateLocalStorage() {
    localStorage.setItem(&quot;itemActions&quot;, JSON.stringify(itemActions));
    localStorage.setItem(&quot;cartCount&quot;, itemCount);
  }

  // Function to update cart count
  function updateCartCount() {
    cartCount.textContent = itemCount;
  }
  updateCartCount(); // Update the cart count display
  updateLocalStorage(); // Update local storage with the new action

  /////////////////////// SEE MORE FETCH /////////////////////////
  const seeMoreBtn = document.getElementById(&quot;seeMoreBtn&quot;);
  const productsContainer = document.querySelector(&quot;#newArrivals&quot;);

  let offset = 10; // Initial offset

  // Fetch more products using AJAX when &quot;See More&quot; is clicked

  seeMoreBtn.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, function () {
    const xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
    xhr.open(&quot;GET&quot;, &quot;generate_boxes.php?offset=&quot; + offset, true);
    xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {
      if (xhr.readyState === 4 &amp;&amp; xhr.status === 200) {
        // Create a temporary container to hold the new products
        const tempContainer = document.createElement(&quot;div&quot;);
        tempContainer.innerHTML = xhr.responseText;

        // Get the individual product boxes from the temporary container
        const newProductBoxes = tempContainer.querySelectorAll(&quot;.product_box&quot;);

        // Append each new product box to the main products container
        newProductBoxes.forEach(function (box) {
          productsContainer.appendChild(box);

          // Reattach event listener for the new &quot;Add to Cart&quot; buttons
          const newAddToCartButton = box.querySelector(&quot;.bx-cart-add&quot;);
          newAddToCartButton.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, addToCart);

          // Reattach event listener for the new &quot;Check&quot; icon
          const newCheckIcon = box.querySelector(&quot;.bx-check&quot;);
          newCheckIcon.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, toggleCheckIcon);
          updateCartCount(); // Update the cart count display
          updateLocalStorage(); // Update local storage with the new action
        });

        offset += 10; // Increment the offset for the next batch
      }
    };
    xhr.send();
  });
});
</code></pre>
<p>I am trying to save the add to cart action in local storage for the new generated boxes</p>

Title: Ansible VMWare Expand Disk
Body:
<p>What is Expected:</p>
<p>The playbook  will gather facts get the current drive space for a virtual machine and then add 30% to the disk.  It will then power down the VM and increase the drive by the 30% and boot it back up.  Once powered up ansible should then run the PowerShell script to expand the drive to 100% capacity.   This is what is expected.</p>
<p>What's happening is it fails at the PowerShell side of things.</p>
<pre class="lang-yaml prettyprint-override"><code>  - name: Disk extension
    win_partition:
      state: present
      partition_size: -1
      disk_number: 0
      partition_number: 2
</code></pre>
<p>This works to expand in vmware, I just need some help getting the aforementioned working in my code.  Hope that is understandable.</p>
<pre class="lang-yaml prettyprint-override"><code>---
- name: vm disk expansion
  hosts: localhost
  become: false
  gather_facts: false

  tasks:
  - name: Get all disks from existing VM
    vmware_guest_disk_info:
      validate_certs: False
      datacenter: '{{ data_center }}'
      name: '{{ vm_name  }}'
    register: existing_disk

  - name: Get Backing datastore for desired disk id
    set_fact:
      disk_zero_datastore: &quot;{{ item.value.backing_datastore }}&quot;
    with_dict: &quot;{{ existing_disk.guest_disk_info }}&quot;
    when: item.key == '0'
  
  - debug:
      msg: &quot;{{ disk_zero_datastore }}&quot;
    when: disk_zero_datastore is defined

  - name: Get scsi controller type
    set_fact:
      scsi_type: &quot;{{ item.value.controller_type }}&quot;
    with_dict: &quot;{{ existing_disk.guest_disk_info }}&quot;
    when: item.key == '0'

  - debug:
      msg: '{{ scsi_type }}'
    when: scsi_type is defined


  - name: Get Unit Number
    set_fact:
      unit_number: &quot;{{ item.value.unit_number }}&quot;
    with_dict: &quot;{{ existing_disk.guest_disk_info }}&quot;
    when: item.key == '0'

  - debug:
      msg: '{{ unit_number }}'
    when: unit_number is defined


  - name: Get Disk + 30%
    set_fact:
      disc_size: &quot;{{ item.value.capacity_in_kb|int *13/10| round(2, 'floor')|int }}&quot;
    with_dict: &quot;{{ existing_disk.guest_disk_info }}&quot;
    when: item.key == '0'
  
  - debug:
      msg: '{{ disc_size }}'
    when: disc_size is defined

  - name: Connect to VMWare and shutdown guest
    community.vmware.vmware_guest:
      validate_certs: no
      datacenter: &quot;{{ data_center }}&quot;
      name: &quot;{{ vm_name }}&quot;
      state: shutdownguest
    delegate_to: localhost
    failed_when: vm_shutdown.instance.hw_power_status != 'poweredOff' and vm_shutdown.changed == false
    register: vm_shutdown

  - name: Wait 15 seconds
    ansible.builtin.pause:
      seconds: 15

  - name: Connect to VMWare and resize disk on VM
    community.vmware.vmware_guest_disk:
      validate_certs: no
      datacenter: &quot;{{ data_center }}&quot;
      name: &quot;{{ vm_name }}&quot;
      disk:
        - size_kb: &quot;{{ disc_size|int }}&quot;
          state: present
          unit_number: &quot;{{ unit_number }}&quot;
          scsi_controller: 0
          scsi_type: &quot;{{ scsi_type }}&quot;
    delegate_to: localhost
    register: disk_facts

  - name: Connect to VMWare and boot up guest
    community.vmware.vmware_guest:
      validate_certs: no
      name: &quot;{{ vm_name }}&quot;
      state: poweredon
    delegate_to: localhost
#    register: disk_facts

  - name: Wait 300 seconds, but only start checking after 15 seconds
    wait_for_connection:
      delay: 15
      timeout: 300
  
  - name: Extend disk to 100%
</code></pre>

Title: scheduled tasks via cmd / quoting Problem
Body:
<p>I've a problem with quotes when creating scheduled tasks over command line.
I try to create a task which starts a batch script and passes some parameters to it.
The command looks like following:</p>
<pre><code> SCHTASKS /CREATE /RU &quot;MyUserName&quot; /SC ONCE /ST 00:00 /TN &quot;TestTask&quot; /TR &quot;D:\Thats\my\script.bat 'P:\aram\one' 'P:\aram\two\'&quot; /IT /F 
</code></pre>
<p>Now, the task gets created but if I check it via</p>
<pre><code>CHTASKS /query /TN &quot;TestTask&quot; /FO List /V
</code></pre>
<p>I get following info:</p>
<pre><code>D:\Thats\my\script.bat &quot;P:\aram\one&quot; &quot;P:\aram\two\'
</code></pre>
<p>instead of following info:</p>
<pre><code>D:\Thats\my\script.bat &quot;P:\aram\one&quot; &quot;P:\aram\two\&quot;
</code></pre>
<p>The second <strong>info</strong> has a double high quote at the end and the first one not.
May some one asks what kind of path that is which ends with a slash, but I do need it for a script.</p>
<p>My second question is why the task scheduler seems to change every single quotes into double quotes.</p>

Title: How to request permission to send notifications Android?
Body:
<p>How do I create a pop-up window when launching an application with notification permission? In Android 13, this is mandatory. The permissions are already in the manifest. I need to somehow embed a permission request into this code, I do not know how to do it. Help please
This is my class with notifications:</p>
<pre><code>class NotificationReceiver : BroadcastReceiver() {
    private val TAG = &quot;Notifi&quot;
    private var cityName: String = &quot;&quot;
    private var location: String = &quot;&quot;

    override fun onReceive(context: Context, intent: Intent) {
        cityName = intent.getStringExtra(&quot;CITY_KEY&quot;).toString()
        location = intent.getStringExtra(&quot;LOCATION_KEY&quot;).toString()
        sendNotification(context)
    }

    @OptIn(DelicateCoroutinesApi::class)
    @SuppressLint(&quot;MissingPermission&quot;)
    private fun sendNotification(context: Context) {
        val mainActivityIntent = Intent(context, MainActivity::class.java)
        mainActivityIntent.flags = Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK or Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TASK
        val pendingIntent = PendingIntent.getActivity(context, 0, mainActivityIntent, PendingIntent.FLAG_IMMUTABLE)
        // Создайте канал уведомления для Android Oreo и выше
        if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT &gt;= Build.VERSION_CODES.O) {
            val name = &quot;NotificationChannelName&quot;
            val descriptionText = &quot;NotificationChannelDescription&quot;
            val importance = NotificationManager.IMPORTANCE_DEFAULT
            val channel = NotificationChannel(&quot;CHANNEL_ID&quot;, name, importance).apply {
                description = descriptionText
            }
            val notificationManager: NotificationManager = context.getSystemService(Context.NOTIFICATION_SERVICE) as NotificationManager
            notificationManager.createNotificationChannel(channel)
            Log.d(TAG, &quot;Step 1&quot;)
        }

        val expandedView = RemoteViews(context.packageName, R.layout.notification_expanded)


        Log.d(TAG, &quot;Сообщение отправилось&quot;)

        GlobalScope.launch(Dispatchers.Main) {
            try {
                val dataForNotifi = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
                    fetchWeatherData(0, cityName, location)
                }

                val collapsedView = RemoteViews(context.packageName, R.layout.custom_collapsed_notification)
                collapsedView.setTextViewText(R.id.notification_text1, dataForNotifi.pushCurrentTemp)
                collapsedView.setTextViewText(R.id.notification_text2, dataForNotifi.pushMaxMin)
                // Установите ресурсы изображений для ImageView
                collapsedView.setImageViewResource(R.id.notification_icon, R.drawable.ic_app_push)
                collapsedView.setImageViewResource(R.id.notification_icon2, dataForNotifi.pushCurrentImage)

                // Создайте уведомление
                val builder = NotificationCompat.Builder(context, &quot;CHANNEL_ID&quot;)
                    .setSmallIcon(R.drawable.ic_app_push)
                    .setStyle(NotificationCompat.DecoratedCustomViewStyle())
                    .setCustomContentView(collapsedView)
                    .setCustomBigContentView(expandedView)
                    .setContentIntent(pendingIntent) // &lt;- добавьте PendingIntent к сборщику уведомлений (NotificationCompat.Builder)
                    .setAutoCancel(true) // &lt;- это остановит уведомление после нажатия на него

                val notificationManagerCompat = NotificationManagerCompat.from(context)
                notificationManagerCompat.notify(1, builder.build())

                val currentTime = Calendar.getInstance().timeInMillis
                val dateFormat = DateFormat.getTimeInstance(DateFormat.SHORT, Locale.getDefault())
                val timeFormatted = dateFormat.format(currentTime)

                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_address, dataForNotifi.pushAddress)
                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_time, timeFormatted)
                expandedView.setImageViewResource(R.id.push_current_image, dataForNotifi.pushCurrentImage)
                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_current_temp, dataForNotifi.pushCurrentTemp)

                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_firstcase_day, dataForNotifi.pushFirstCaseDay)
                expandedView.setImageViewResource(R.id.push_firstcase_image, dataForNotifi.pushFirstCaseImage)
                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_firstcase_temp, dataForNotifi.pushFirstCaseTemp)

                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_secondcase_day, dataForNotifi.pushSecondCaseDay)
                expandedView.setImageViewResource(R.id.push_secondcase_image, dataForNotifi.pushSecondCaseImage)
                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_secondcase_temp, dataForNotifi.pushSecondCaseTemp)

                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_thirdcase_day, dataForNotifi.pushThirdCaseDay)
                expandedView.setImageViewResource(R.id.push_thirdcase_image, dataForNotifi.pushThirdCaseImage)
                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_thirdcase_temp, dataForNotifi.pushThirdCaseTemp)

                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_fourthcase_day, dataForNotifi.pushFourthCaseDay)
                expandedView.setImageViewResource(R.id.push_fourthcase_image, dataForNotifi.pushFourthCaseImage)
                expandedView.setTextViewText(R.id.push_fourthcase_temp, dataForNotifi.pushFourthCaseTemp)

                // Обновите уведомление
                notificationManagerCompat.notify(1, builder.build())

                Log.d(TAG, &quot;Сообщение обновилось&quot;)
            } catch (e: Exception) {
                // Обработка ошибок
                Log.e(TAG, &quot;Error: ${e.message}&quot;, e)
            }
        }
    }

    suspend fun fetchWeatherData(position: Int, cityName: String, userLocation: String): DataForNotifi {
        val weather = Weather()
        return suspendCancellableCoroutine { continuation -&gt;
            weather.getWeatherData(position, cityName, userLocation) { _, _, _, dataForNotifi -&gt;
                continuation.resume(dataForNotifi)
            }
        }
    }
}
</code></pre>
<p>And this is the code in the activity:</p>
<pre><code>private fun setupNotificationAlarm() {
        val alarmManager = getSystemService(Context.ALARM_SERVICE) as AlarmManager
        val intent = Intent(this, NotificationReceiver::class.java)

        intent.putExtra(&quot;CITY_KEY&quot;, city)
        intent.putExtra(&quot;LOCATION_KEY&quot;, coordinates)
        
        val pendingIntent = PendingIntent.getBroadcast(
            this, 0, intent,
            PendingIntent.FLAG_UPDATE_CURRENT or FLAG_IMMUTABLE
        )
        
        val intervalInMillis = TimeUnit.MINUTES.toMillis(1)

        alarmManager.setExact(
            AlarmManager.ELAPSED_REALTIME_WAKEUP,
            SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() + intervalInMillis,
            pendingIntent
        )
    }

    private fun requestExactAlarmPermission() {
        if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT &gt;= Build.VERSION_CODES.S) {
            val alarmManager = getSystemService(Context.ALARM_SERVICE) as AlarmManager

            if (!alarmManager.canScheduleExactAlarms()) {
                val intent = Intent(Settings.ACTION_REQUEST_SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM).apply {data = Uri.fromParts(&quot;package&quot;, packageName, null)
                }
                val requestCode = 0
                startActivityForResult(intent, requestCode)
            }
        }
    }
</code></pre>

Title: How to export a list of all users that have access to reports from a Power BI Workspace?
Body:
<p>I am trying to audit Power BI reports and datasets to see who have access to which reports. Is there an API that allows to do so?</p>
<p>Ideally, my output file should have at least three columns: report, user, level of access</p>
<p>Is it possible to get this type of data?</p>
<p>I have tried using PowerShell's MicrosoftPowerBiMgmt module. It allows to list my reports and datasets but doesn't show the users who have access to reports/datasets.</p>
<p>For instance,
<code>Invoke-PowerBIRestMethod -Url 'groups/&lt;WORKSPACE_ID&gt;/reports/&lt;REPORT_ID&gt;' -Method Get</code>
returns some metadata about the report but shows no users or subscriptions.</p>

Title: Sometimes not receiving flowable updates if room update happens immediately after insert
Body:
<p>I am using room with rxjava and I have one database with 2 tables. The former table has fields id and status, where status can be 0 or 1. The latter has a foreign key which is the id from table 1.</p>
<p>In DAO part, the insert into the latter and the update in the former on a single entry are Completables. These operations happen in an android service, both subscribeOn and observeOn are done on Schedulers.io().</p>
<p>Now in a separate thread, I am subscribing to a Flowable that is a select query on the latter table which retrieves the latest entry that has the associated entry in the former tabel with a status value of 1. The flowable also is subscribedOn and observedOn on Schedulers.io().</p>
<p>Now, I have a certain condition on which I have to insert an entry into the second table and immediately, in doOnComplete of this action, I update the status of the associated element in the first table to value 0. Most of the times I receive updates in flowable, but once in 10-15-20 times, the flowable does not emit anything, as if the update is done before the emission and there is nothing to emit because the condition that status has to be 1 is not met.</p>
<p>I included the insert and the update in the same transaction but it didn't help. I also tried to annotate the query used by flowable to @Transaction, the same result. Once every 10-15-20 times, I don't get an emission. I am also using the latest versions of room, sqlite and rxjava3. I expect to see the update on the table in flowable as soon as the insert is finished. It doesn't matter if the flowable emits after the update is finished, I just wish to receive an emission. If I put a small delay of 5ms between the insert and the update, then there is time for the hook to emit using flowable, but I do not wish to use delays.</p>

Title: Gradle, embedded-kafka: Symbol 'type org.apache.zookeeper.server.ServerCnxnFactory' is missing from the classpath
Body:
<p>I am trying to add <a href="https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/io.github.embeddedkafka/embedded-kafka" rel="nofollow noreferrer">embedded-kafka</a> to my gradle dependencies.</p>
<ol>
<li>The build passes, but running a test which uses <code>with EmbeddedKafka</code> gives the following error:</li>
</ol>
<pre><code>Symbol 'type org.apache.zookeeper.server.ServerCnxnFactory' is missing from the classpath.
This symbol is required by 'method io.github.embeddedkafka.ops.ZooKeeperOps.startZooKeeper'.
Make sure that type ServerCnxnFactory is in your classpath and check for conflicting dependencies with `-Ylog-classpath`.
A full rebuild may help if 'ZooKeeperOps.class' was compiled against an incompatible version of org.apache.zookeeper.server.

Title: While loop vs recursion differences in try, except, finally error handling
Body:
<p>What are the differences between using a <code>while</code> loop vs recursion in <code>try</code>, <code>except</code>, <code>finally</code> error handling?</p>
<p>When I use a <code>while</code> loop in user input error handling:</p>
<pre><code>while True:
    try:
        user_num = float(input(&quot;Enter a number: &quot;)
        break
    except ValueError as e:
        print(&quot;That is not a number. Error:&quot;, e)
    finally:
        print(&quot;Cycle is done.&quot;)
</code></pre>
<p>The code loops until there are no errors and each loop prints <code>&quot;Cycle is done.&quot;</code></p>
<p>When I use recursion instead of a <code>while</code> loop:</p>
<pre><code>try:
    user_num = float(input(&quot;Enter a number: &quot;)
except ValueError as e:
    print(&quot;That is not a number. Error:&quot;, e)
    get_num()
finally:
    print(&quot;Cycle is done.&quot;)
</code></pre>
<p>The code loops until there is no error as well and after a success it prints <code>&quot;Cycle is done.&quot;</code> * n where n = number of cycles.</p>
<p>Initially I expected them both to run the same.
It seems that the <code>while</code> loop will hit the <code>finally</code> section before looping, and that the recursion method is still executing the <code>except</code> code so after a success, every call reaches <code>finally</code> in LIFO order.</p>
<p>I read that the recursion method will eventually raise a <code>RecursionError: maximum recursion depth exceeded</code> error if cycled long enough.</p>
<p>Are there other differences between these two methods of looping error handling?</p>

I have a riddle for you.

Suppose there are 10 fish in an aquarium ("home"). The aquarium has two doors: one door (A) leads to freedom, the other door (B) leads to another aquarium ("remote").

The door A only opens if there is at least one fish in the "remote"  aquarium. and it doesn't open if there are more than two fish in the "home"  aquarium.

In the "remote" aquarium there is a feeder which only works if there are no fish in the "home"  aquarium. All of the fish are very hungry.

With which strategy can the maximum amount of fish escape to freedom and survive?

Prompt:
5.1 Task-Mapping Programming Paradigm
One key challenge when optimizing tensor programs for certain
hardware with parallel processing units (e.g., modern CPUs, GPUs,
and TPUs) is how to assign the independent (sub) tasks to the
parallel processing units. Using cooperative loading in Figure 8 as
an example, when loading the fragment of matrix A with shape
64x8 from global memory to shared memory, the 512 tasks are
assigned to the 128 threads in a thread block, and each thread is
assigned with 4 loading tasks. In this example, tasks are assigned
to parallel processing units, called workers, and the tasks assigned
to each worker will be executed in a specific order. In this section,
we will first formalize the task assignment and ordering as task
mapping, then introduce a binary operator on task mappings to
compose task mappings, and finally discuss the scheduling based
on task mappings.

docs/usage.md:
```
# Developing External Projects with Junior

## Installation

Install Junior as a development dependency by running the following command:

```
npm add @aijunior/dev --save-dev
```

## Initialization

You can initialize the necessary files in the repository with the command:

```
npx junior-init
```

This will create the following files:

```
.gitignore
prompt/projectSpecifics.md
prompt.yaml
```

The Task Interaction Files will be gitignored:
  - `prompt.yaml`, the prompt descriptor filled by the user ([link to descriptor.md](./descriptor.md))
  - `prompt.md`, the generated prompt by Junior
  - `change.sh`, the changeset generated by the language model

### Project Specifics

`prompt/projectSpecifics.md` is used to provide instructions about the codebase that Junior is working on, like preferred tools. It is important to keep this file minimal as it will be included in most prompts, and unnecessary complexity may result in the language model losing track and failing to solve the task.

## Starting Junior

You can start Junior with:

```
npx junior-web
```

For more information about the web interface, please refer to [web.md](./web.md).


```


# Task

Improve the documentation!

- "This will create the following files:": edit or create - Remove "link to", unnecessary - Add abbreviaton: TIF


# Output Format

Encode and enclose your results as ./change.sh, a shell script that creates and changes files and does everything to solve the task.
Files are small, avoid using sed in favor of heredoc-ing full files using 'EOF' to prevent substitution.

OS: OSX

Installed tools: npm, jq


Do NOT write any text outside the script!

EXAMPLE START

```sh
#!/bin/sh
set -e
goal=[Task description, max 7 words]
echo "Plan:"
echo "1. [...]"
[Commands solving the task]
echo "\033[32mDone: $goal\033[0m\n"
```

EXAMPLE END

Title: Pyttsx3 does not work if speakers are not connected
Body:
<p>Had a need to use <code>pyttsx3</code> on Windows Server 2016, Python version 3.11.1. If the speakers are not connected (via connection before virtual desktop), an error occurs:</p>
<pre><code>line 69, in save_to_file
    temp_stream = self._tts.AudioOutputStream
                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
_ctypes.CMError: (-2147200966, None, (None, None, None, None, 0, None))
</code></pre>
<p>Code:</p>
<pre><code>import pyttsx3

engine = pyttsx3.init(&quot;sapi5&quot;, debug=True)
voices = engine.getProperty(&quot;voices&quot;)
engine.setProperty(&quot;voice&quot;, voices[3].id) #2

temp_file = &quot;temp.wav&quot;

engine.save_to_file(&quot;Hello World!&quot;, temp_file)
engine.runAndWait()
</code></pre>
<p>Almost always the server will run without a connection to the virtual desktop. Tried different ways to fix it, nothing helps. Maybe someone knows how to fix it?</p>
<p>I've tried using programs to simulate connected speakers, but haven't found anything worthwhile. Ideally, the system should synthesize speech without speakers connected.</p>

Title: How to load pass plugin in new pass manager?
Body:
<p>I have written a pass-plugin for obfuscation and I would like to load this plugin using <code>clang</code> instead of <code>opt</code> in Windows. However, when I use the command <code>.\bin\clang++.exe -O1 -Xclang -fpass-plugin='./BronyaObfus.dll' -passes=bogus-control-flow .\test.cpp -o .\a.exe</code>, clang throws an error:</p>
<pre><code>clang++: error: unknown argument: '-passes=bogus-control-flow'
</code></pre>
<p>Then I use <code>.\bin\clang++.exe -O1 -Xclang -fpass-plugin='./BronyaObfus.dll' -mllvm --bogus-control-flow .\test.cpp -o .\a.exe</code></p>
<p>It didn't load the corresponding pass(bogus-control-flow) as expected, instead, it loaded all passes.</p>
<p>This is my registry code:</p>
<pre class="lang-cpp prettyprint-override"><code>llvm::PassPluginLibraryInfo getBronyaObfusPluginInfo() {
  return {LLVM_PLUGIN_API_VERSION, &quot;BronyaObfus&quot;, &quot;v0.1&quot;, [](PassBuilder &amp;PB) {
            PB.registerPipelineParsingCallback(
                [](StringRef PassName, FunctionPassManager &amp;FPM, ...) {
                  if (PassName == &quot;bogus-control-flow&quot;) {
                    FPM.addPass(BogusControlFlowPass());
                    return true;
                  }

                  if (PassName == &quot;flattening&quot;) {
                    FPM.addPass(FlatteningPass());
                    return true;
                  }

                  if (PassName == &quot;mba-obfuscation&quot;) {
                    FPM.addPass(MBAObfuscationPass());
                    return true;
                  }
                  return false;
                });

            PB.registerPipelineParsingCallback(
                [](StringRef PassName, ModulePassManager &amp;MPM, ...) {
                  if (PassName == &quot;string-obfuscation&quot;) {
                    MPM.addPass(StringObfuscationPass());
                    return true;
                  }
                  return false;
                });

            PB.registerPipelineStartEPCallback([](ModulePassManager &amp;MPM,
                                                  OptimizationLevel Level) {
              MPM.addPass(StringObfuscationPass());

              FunctionPassManager FPM;
              FPM.addPass(BogusControlFlowPass());
              FPM.addPass(FlatteningPass());
              FPM.addPass(MBAObfuscationPass());

              MPM.addPass(createModuleToFunctionPassAdaptor(std::move(FPM)));
            });

          }};
}

extern &quot;C&quot; LLVM_ATTRIBUTE_WEAK ::llvm::PassPluginLibraryInfo
llvmGetPassPluginInfo() {
  return getBronyaObfusPluginInfo();
}
</code></pre>
<p>If I just want to load <code>bogus-control-flow</code> pass, how should I pass arguments to clang?</p>

Title: I need to access firebase storage files metadata from a particular folder in the bucket in C# unity
Body:
<p>I am unable to find a method to parse through all the files in a firebase storage folder from C# script in Unity and get their metadata to find the latest created file using CreationTimeMillis. Is there any way that is possible.</p>
<p>This is what I tried but the ListAll() method is apparently only available for the web calls and not Unity:</p>
<pre><code>private async void FindLatestFileStartingWithA(string extension)
{
    StorageReference folderRef = storageReference.Child(&quot;csv_folder&quot;);
    List&lt;string&gt; fileList = new List&lt;string&gt;();

    try
    {
        var listResult = await folderRef.ListAll();

        foreach (StorageReference fileRef in listResult.Items)
        {
            string fileName = fileRef.Name;
            if (fileName.StartsWith(&quot;A&quot;) &amp;&amp; fileName.EndsWith(extension))
            {
                fileList.Add(fileName);
            }
        }

        if (fileList.Any())
        {
            string latestFile = fileList[fileList.Count - 1]; // Get the last (latest) file
            Debug.Log(&quot;Latest file starting with 'A': &quot; + latestFile);
            file_name = latestFile;

            // Now that we have the latest file name, start the download process
            StartCoroutine(DownloadCSV(file_name));
        }
        else
        {
            Debug.Log(&quot;No file found starting with 'A'.&quot;);
        }
    }
    catch (Exception e)
    {
        Debug.LogError(&quot;Error listing files: &quot; + e.Message);
    }
}
</code></pre>

Prompt: 'src', 'frontend',  are not needed

Title: Authentication and Authorization in Razor Page by JWT and Google
Body:
<p>I have a project using google authen and i want to use JWT to authorization without using Identity. It is doesn't work, although I saw a lot of tutorials. This is my code, where is it wrong?<br />
This is the config in Program (I wrote app.Use correctly):</p>
<pre><code>builder.Services
.AddAuthentication(options =&gt;
{
    options.DefaultAuthenticateScheme = JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme;
    //options.DefaultScheme = CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme;
    options.DefaultSignInScheme = &quot;Cookies&quot;;
    options.DefaultChallengeScheme = JwtBearerDefaults.AuthenticationScheme;
})
.AddCookie(&quot;Cookies&quot;)
.AddJwtBearer(options =&gt;
{
    options.TokenValidationParameters = new TokenValidationParameters
    {
        ValidateIssuerSigningKey = true,
        IssuerSigningKey = new SymmetricSecurityKey(Encoding.UTF8
            .GetBytes(builder.Configuration.GetSection(&quot;AppSettings:Token&quot;).Value)),
        ValidateIssuer = false,
        ValidateAudience = false,
    };
})
.AddGoogle(
     options =&gt;
    {
        IConfiguration googleAuthen = builder.Configuration.GetSection(&quot;Authentication:Google&quot;);
        options.SaveTokens = true;
        options.ClientId = googleAuthen[&quot;ClientId&quot;];
        options.ClientSecret = googleAuthen[&quot;ClientSecret&quot;];
        options.CorrelationCookie.SameSite = SameSiteMode.Lax;
    }
);
</code></pre>
<p>Code in LoginModel:</p>
<pre><code>        public IActionResult OnPostLoginByGoogle()
    {
        string authenticationScheme = GoogleDefaults.AuthenticationScheme;

        var auth = new AuthenticationProperties
        {
            RedirectUri = Url.Page(&quot;/Login&quot;, pageHandler: &quot;LoginGoogleCallback&quot;)
        };

        return new ChallengeResult(authenticationScheme, auth);
    }

    public async Task&lt;IActionResult&gt; OnGetLoginGoogleCallbackAsync()
    {
        var authenticateResult = await HttpContext.AuthenticateAsync(CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme);

        if (!authenticateResult.Succeeded)
            return BadRequest(); // TODO: Handle this better.

        var userId = authenticateResult.Principal.FindFirstValue(ClaimTypes.NameIdentifier);
        var userEmail = authenticateResult.Principal.FindFirstValue(ClaimTypes.Email);

        UserDTO loginedUser = _userRepository.GetUserByEmail((string)userEmail);
        
        string token = CreateToken(loginedUser);

        return RedirectToPage(&quot;/Students/TimeTable&quot;);

        //return LocalRedirect(&quot;/test&quot;);
    }

    public string CreateToken(UserDTO user)
    {
        List&lt;Claim&gt; claims = new List&lt;Claim&gt;
        {
            new Claim(ClaimTypes.Name, user.Email),
            new Claim(ClaimTypes.Role, &quot;Student&quot;),
        };
        var key = new SymmetricSecurityKey(System.Text.Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes(
            _configuration.GetSection(&quot;AppSettings:Token&quot;).Value));
        var cred = new SigningCredentials(key, SecurityAlgorithms.HmacSha512Signature);
        
        var token = new JwtSecurityToken(
            claims: claims,
            expires: DateTime.Now.AddDays(1),
            signingCredentials: cred
            );
        var jwt = new JwtSecurityTokenHandler().WriteToken(token);
        
        return jwt;
    }
</code></pre>
<p>and in the another Page I wrote <code>[Authorize(Roles = &quot;Student&quot;)]</code> and the result when directing to that page is HTTP 401 unAuthorized (I was assigning ClaimTypes.Role = Student to test easily)</p>

Title: Is there any way for git diff to diff files encoded in UTF-8 BOM properly?
Body:
<p>I have a git repository in which all files are encoded in UTF8-BOM, this encoding causes nothing but problems but I have no choice on this matter. When I try to run <code>git diff</code> to check changes between branches or commits, sometimes git thinks the entire file changed due to stripping BOM from one side, making the output of the diff is useless most of the time.</p>
<p>I have tried the <code>-w</code> option but it didn't work, also seen answers in which they filter out the BOM but i can't get them to work on Windows 11 with powershell or with git bash but i think the output would be erroneous in case the BOM actually got removed in a commit.</p>

Title: Generate a JsonSchema from a c# class including conditional member setters logic
Body:
<p>I Have the following Class</p>
<pre><code>Class Creature
    {
         public string Name {get; set;}
         private string _clss;
         public string Clss 
         {
            get {return _clss} 
            set 
            {
                if(Mapping.dic.ContainsKey(value))
                {
                    _clss = value;
                }
            }
         }
         private List&lt;string&gt; _specs = new List&lt;string&gt;();
         public List&lt;string&gt; Specs
         {
            get {return _specs}
            set
            {
                if(Mapping.dic.ContainsKey(value))
                {
                    foreach(var item in value)
                    {
                       if(Mapping.dic[this.Clss].Contains(item)
                       {
                          _specs.Add(item);
                       }
                    }
                }
         }
    }
</code></pre>
<p>And i have the following dictionary in a static class that i use for mapping</p>
<pre><code>static class Mapping
{
   public static Dictionary&lt;string,HashSet&lt;string&gt;&gt; dic
   {
       get
       {
          Dictionary&lt;string, HashSet&lt;string&gt;&gt; dic = new Dictionary&lt;string, HashSet&lt;string&gt;&gt;();
          dic.Add(&quot;Mage&quot;, new HashSet&lt;string&gt;() {&quot;magic&quot;, &quot;fast&quot;, &quot;old&quot;});
          dic.Add(&quot;Monster&quot;, new HashSet&lt;string&gt;() {&quot;magic&quot;, &quot;strong&quot;});
          dic.Add(&quot;Warrior&quot;, new HashSet&lt;string&gt;() {&quot;strong&quot;, &quot;old&quot;,&quot;slow&quot;});
          return dic;
       }
   }
}
</code></pre>
<p>using NJsonSchema to generate a schema for the Creature class will result in a schema that won't include any representation of the logic that's defined in the custom setters code</p>
<pre><code>var schema = JsonSchema.FromType(typeof(Creature));
var data = schema.ToJson();
</code></pre>
<p>the result schema would be:</p>
<pre><code>{
   &quot;$schema&quot;: &quot;http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#&quot;,
   &quot;title&quot;: &quot;Creature&quot;,
   &quot;type&quot;: &quot;object&quot;,
   &quot;additionalProperties&quot;: false,
   &quot;properties&quot;: {
   &quot;Name&quot;: {
     &quot;type&quot;: &quot;string&quot;
   },
   &quot;Clss&quot;: {
     &quot;type&quot;: &quot;string&quot;
   },
   &quot;Specs&quot;: {
     &quot;type&quot;: &quot;array&quot;,
     &quot;items&quot;: {
        &quot;type&quot;: &quot;string&quot;
     }
   }
  }
}
</code></pre>
<p>now i tried with a reverse process where i wrote the Schema first and generate the C# class from it using the NJsonSchema code generator</p>
<p>the manually generated schema :</p>
<pre><code>   {
      &quot;$schema&quot;: &quot;http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#&quot;,
      &quot;title&quot;: &quot;Creature&quot;,
      &quot;type&quot;: &quot;object&quot;,
      &quot;properties&quot;: {
        &quot;Clss&quot;: {
          &quot;type&quot;: &quot;string&quot;,
          &quot;enum&quot;: [&quot;Mage&quot;, &quot;Monster&quot;, &quot;Warrior&quot;]
        },
        &quot;Specs&quot;: {
          &quot;type&quot;: &quot;string&quot;
        }
      },
      &quot;required&quot;: [&quot;Clss&quot;, &quot;Specs&quot;],
      &quot;dependencies&quot;: {
        &quot;Specs&quot;: {
          &quot;oneOf&quot;: [
            {
              &quot;properties&quot;: {
                &quot;Clss&quot;: { &quot;const&quot;: &quot;Mage&quot; },
                &quot;Specs&quot;: { &quot;enum&quot;: [&quot;magic&quot;, &quot;fast&quot;, &quot;old&quot;] }
              }
            },
            {
              &quot;properties&quot;: {
                &quot;Clss&quot;: { &quot;const&quot;: &quot;Monster&quot; },
                &quot;Specs&quot;: { &quot;enum&quot;: [&quot;magic&quot;, &quot;strong&quot;] }
              }
            },
            {
              &quot;properties&quot;: {
                &quot;Clss&quot;: { &quot;const&quot;: &quot;Warrior&quot; },
                &quot;Specs&quot;: { &quot;enum&quot;: [&quot;strong&quot;, &quot;old&quot;, &quot;slow&quot;] }
              }
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    }
</code></pre>
<p>when passed to a c# code generator using the following logic</p>
<pre><code>    string JsonString = &quot;&quot; // the json goes here formating this is pain and the post is long already 
    var sc = await JsonSchema.FromJsonAsync(JsonString);
    var generator = new CSharpGenerator(sc);
    var file = generator.GenerateFile();
</code></pre>
<p>the generated C# class :</p>
<pre><code>//----------------------
// &lt;auto-generated&gt;
//     Generated using the NJsonSchema v10.9.0.0 (Newtonsoft.Json v13.0.0.0) (http://NJsonSchema.org)
// &lt;/auto-generated&gt;
//----------------------


namespace MyNamespace
{
    #pragma warning disable // Disable all warnings

    [System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratedCode(&quot;NJsonSchema&quot;, &quot;10.9.0.0 (Newtonsoft.Json v13.0.0.0)&quot;)]
    public partial class Anonymous
    {
        [Newtonsoft.Json.JsonProperty(&quot;clss&quot;, Required = Newtonsoft.Json.Required.Always)]
        [System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Required(AllowEmptyStrings = true)]
        [Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConverter(typeof(Newtonsoft.Json.Converters.StringEnumConverter))]
        public Clss Clss { get; set; }

        [Newtonsoft.Json.JsonProperty(&quot;specs&quot;, Required = Newtonsoft.Json.Required.Always)]
        [System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Required(AllowEmptyStrings = true)]
        public string Specs { get; set; }



        private System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary&lt;string, object&gt; _additionalProperties;

        [Newtonsoft.Json.JsonExtensionData]
        public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary&lt;string, object&gt; AdditionalProperties
        {
            get { return _additionalProperties ?? (_additionalProperties = new System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary&lt;string, object&gt;()); }
            set { _additionalProperties = value; }
        }

    }

    [System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratedCode(&quot;NJsonSchema&quot;, &quot;10.9.0.0 (Newtonsoft.Json v13.0.0.0)&quot;)]
    public enum Clss
    {

        [System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMember(Value = @&quot;Mage&quot;)]
        Mage = 0,


        [System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMember(Value = @&quot;Monster&quot;)]
        Monster = 1,


        [System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMember(Value = @&quot;Warrior&quot;)]
        Warrior = 2,


    }
}
</code></pre>
<p>so my questions are :</p>
<ol>
<li>Is what i am trying to achieve feasible &quot;C# to Json Schema including the custom logic&quot;?</li>
<li>How can i generate a schema with the desired logic using NJsonSchema or any other nuget?</li>
<li>Are there any alternative approaches or methods? i am open to any implementation that achieve the desired output &quot;other than manually editing/Hard coding the generated JSON&quot;.</li>
</ol>

Title: Creating an "accessible" document using Apache FOP - not exactly a very accessible subject
Body:
<p>I am trying to write an .xslt file (as input for <a href="https://xmlgraphics.apache.org/fop/" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Apache FOP</a>) whose purpose is to generate an &quot;accessible&quot; document (in our case that means: the generated PDF file must pass the checks done by <a href="https://pdfua.foundation/" rel="nofollow noreferrer">PAC - the PDF accessibility checker</a>).</p>
<p>My file is still practically in a &quot;hello world&quot;-state:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;utf-8&quot;?&gt;
&lt;xsl:stylesheet version=&quot;1.0&quot;
    xmlns:xsl=&quot;http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform&quot;
    xmlns:fo=&quot;http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Format&quot;
    xml:lang=&quot;en_US&quot;&gt;
    &lt;xsl:output method=&quot;xml&quot; indent=&quot;yes&quot; /&gt;

    &lt;xsl:template match=&quot;/&quot;&gt;
        &lt;fo:root font-family=&quot;Arial&quot;&gt;
            &lt;fo:layout-master-set&gt;
                &lt;fo:simple-page-master
                    master-name=&quot;A4-portrait&quot; page-height=&quot;29.7cm&quot; page-width=&quot;21.0cm&quot;&gt;
                    &lt;fo:region-body region-name=&quot;main-content&quot; margin=&quot;2cm&quot; /&gt;
                &lt;/fo:simple-page-master&gt;
            &lt;/fo:layout-master-set&gt;
            &lt;fo:page-sequence master-reference=&quot;A4-portrait&quot;&gt;
                &lt;fo:flow flow-name=&quot;main-content&quot;&gt;
                    &lt;fo:block font-family=&quot;Arial&quot;&gt;Hello, &lt;xsl:value-of select=&quot;data/name&quot; /&gt;! This is some sample text.&lt;/fo:block&gt;
                &lt;/fo:flow&gt;
            &lt;/fo:page-sequence&gt;
        &lt;/fo:root&gt;
    &lt;/xsl:template&gt;

&lt;/xsl:stylesheet&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>but I am already getting a couple of &quot;accessibility errors&quot;.</p>
<p>One is <em>&quot;Text object not tagged&quot;</em>. The text object referenced is the fo:block containg the &quot;Hello ...&quot; text. I googled around for quite some time but I found no helpful explanation or description or any guidance what has to be done in such an .fo/.xslt file to create a tagged element in the resulting PDF.</p>
<p>Does some kind soul have an idea or a good link or description on that?</p>
<p>Later addition:</p>
<p>to force FOP to locate the required fonts one has to add snippets like this to the <code>conf\fop.xconf</code>-file:</p>
<pre><code>      &lt;fonts&gt;
       ...
       &lt;font kerning=&quot;yes&quot; embed-url=&quot;file:///c:/Windows/Fonts/arial.ttf&quot; embedding-mode=&quot;subset&quot;&gt;
          &lt;font-triplet name=&quot;Arial&quot; style=&quot;normal&quot; weight=&quot;normal&quot;/&gt;
        &lt;/font&gt;
        ...
      &lt;/fonts&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>Note that these URLs - when pointing to lcoal files - have to contain the <code>file:</code>-protcocol and they need to contain a drive specifier (here: <code>c:</code>). They didn't work for me without these.</p>

Prompt:
I need your help building a small prototype of a simple web app.

I'll start by describing what the app should do, please ask me any questions about any area that wouldn't be clear, and then help me by providing the necessary code to run my app.

App description:

A super simple web page, with a single button. Clicking the button will start recording audio by accessing the microphone (and ask for permission if necessary). Once the button is clicked and recording starts, the same button becomes a Stop button and clicking on it stops the recording.

Once a recording is stopped, it is sent to the OpenAI whisper API for speech to text transcription.

The transcribed audio is then sent to OpenAI GPT API with a prompt requesting clean up and summarization of the transcription.

The GPT output is then displayed on the page.

This is just a prototype, a proof of concept, it doesn't need to be polished, but it must work.

Title: keycloak helm chart to use external database (LDAP)
Body:

<p>When I set the default Postgresql.enabled to false, I receive the following error.</p>
<pre class="lang-bash prettyprint-override"><code>helm install keycloak oci://registry-1.docker.io/bitnamicharts/keycloak --set postgresql.enabled=false
</code></pre>

WARNING: Kubernetes configuration file is world-readable. This is insecure. Location: /home/kube-user/.kube/config
Pulled: registry-1.docker.io/bitnamicharts/keycloak:16.1.1

Title: How does Access-Control-Allow-Origin differ in a curl?
Body:
<p>So I know how the CORS header value on the server side is responsible for throttling of requests from unknown clients/clients not specified by &quot;Access-Control-Allow-Origin&quot; header in response headers. Let me take <a href="https://www.google.com" rel="nofollow noreferrer">https://www.google.com</a> in this case to make the question clear.</p>
<p>I have a mini server up and running on localhost:5500. When I trying making an XHR request (from a script) to <a href="https://www.google.com" rel="nofollow noreferrer">google.com</a> , it rightfully throws up the below CORS error:</p>
<pre><code>Access to XMLHttpRequest at 'https://www.google.com/' from origin has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.
</code></pre>
<p>Upon inspecting one of the XHR requests in the network tab in dev tools, I can see that the &quot;Access-Control-Allow-Origin&quot; header is indeed missing. The only relatable response header is found was:</p>
<pre><code>Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy: same-origin-allow-popups; report-to=&quot;gws&quot;
</code></pre>
<p>Why doesn't this same issue occur when invoking the same request via cURL or Postman, to the extent that I tried passing the exact same headers that were getting passed in the XHR request of my script , to the cURL and Postman requests, but the latter methods returned a successful response.</p>
<p>What exactly is the difference between the two approaches?</p>

Title: Generics in enum for complex type checking
Body:
<p>I got in this situation recently where I was creating a system of defined arguments to be provided to build messages based on an enum to ensure that every element is present in the dynamic args and so that the types are correctly checked on the arguments not to provide a nonsensical arg.</p>
<p>Here is my code:</p>
<pre class="lang-java prettyprint-override"><code>interface ParamList { Class&lt;?&gt; paramType(); }
</code></pre>
<pre class="lang-java prettyprint-override"><code>@AllArgsConstructor
enum ParamType extends ParamList {
    FOO(Foo.class),
    BAR(Bar.class);

    @Getter
    private final Class&lt;?&gt; paramType;
}
</code></pre>
<pre class="lang-java prettyprint-override"><code>class MessageParams&lt;T extends Enum&lt;T&gt; &amp; ParamList&gt; {

    private Map&lt;T, Object&gt; args;

    // constructor...

    public &lt;U&gt; MessageArgs&lt;T&gt; put(T key, U value) {
        args.put(key, value);
        return this;
    }

    // get...
}
</code></pre>
<p>My problem is int he last class: <code>MessageParams</code>. I wonder if I could enforce the <code>U value</code> to be the <code>paramType()</code> of the provided <code>T</code> at compile-time (I omitted here my runtime check) so that I don't need to explicitly provide the generic when calling put to get correct hinting.</p>
